events.name: trayClickLaunchedApp
events.summary: Fired when a tray notification is shown and the application is not running.
events.description:
Touching it launches the app, and fires this event.

This is only applicable if you have set showTrayNotification to true.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this into an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: trayClickFocusedApp
events.summary: Fired when a tray notification is shown and the application is already running.
events.description:
Touching it focuses the app, and fires this event.

This is only applicable if you have set showTrayNotification to true.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this into an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: callback
events.summary: Fired whenever a push notification is received.
events.description:
If your application is not running when a push is received, the push will be saved in a queue until the next time you add an event listener for this.

This will only be fired once per push notification.

This event will be fired at different times depending on your settings and the application's present state (foreground, background, or not running at all). When focusAppOnPush is true, this will fire as soon as you receive a push. When showTrayNotification is true, this will fire as soon as the user touches the tray notification to focus your application. Or, if showTrayNotificationsWhenFocused is false, and your application is in the foreground, it will be called right away. If both focusAppOnPush and showTrayNotification are false, this will fire the next time your application is launched and you add an event listener for it.

You can use the trayClickLaunchedApp and trayClickFocusedApp events to distinguish between the various ways a push notification can return a user to your application.

properties.name: payload
properties.summary: A JSON string of your data payload. Use JSON.parse to turn this into an object you can use.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: clearStatus
methods.summary: Clears the CloudPush module's stored status, including the push type, device token, GCM sender ID, etc.
methods.description: This method is useful to transfer the push type from MQTT to GCM, or changing the GCM sender ID when needed. After calling this method, the CloudPush module is reinitialized. Use retrieveDeviceToken to get the device token again.

methods.name: retrieveDeviceToken
methods.summary: Asynchronously retrieves the application specific device token.
methods.description: This token is used in calls to Appcelerator Cloud Services to subscribe or unsubscribe to push notification channels. This token is unique to each application and device.

parameters.name: config
parameters.summary: Dictionary specifying token retrieval related options.

properties.name: retrieveDeviceToken

deprecated.notes: This property was only required to enable push notifications for the legacy MQTT protocol.

properties.summary: Whether or not this device will receive push notifications.

properties.name: focusAppOnPush
properties.summary: Whether or not your application is brought to the foreground whenever a new push is received.
properties.description: Note that this behavior is rather disruptive to users, and is strongly discouraged.

properties.name: showAppOnTrayClick
properties.summary: Whether or not clicking the tray notification will bring your application to the foreground.
properties.description: This is only applicable if you have set showTrayNotification to true.

properties.name: showTrayNotification
properties.summary: Whether or not to show a tray notification when a new push is received.
properties.description:
If your payload is only a string, it will be used as the contentText and tickerText, and your application's name will be used as the contentTitle with a system icon.

Note that in your payload, you can customize this tray notification using any of the properties of a Titanium.Android.Notification, except for contentIntent and deleteIntent (those are automatically set).

properties.name: showTrayNotificationsWhenFocused
properties.summary: Whether or not to show tray notifications when your application is in the foreground.
properties.description:
Instead of showing a notification, the callback event will be immediately fired instead.

This is only applicable if you have set showTrayNotification to true.

properties.name: singleCallback
properties.summary: Set to true to trigger a single callback for the selected push notification when multiple push notifications are displayed in the tray.
properties.description:
In previous versions of the module, clicking on one of the application's push notifications triggered the callbacks for all of the application's push notifications. The new module retains the same behavior by default.

Set this property to true to receive a single callback for the push notification selected by the user, regardless of how many push notifications are displayed in the tray.

constants.name: SERVICE_DISABLED
constants.summary: Code returned from <Modules.PlayServices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable>. Google Play services has been disabled on this device.

constants.name: SERVICE_INVALID
constants.summary: Code returned from <Modules.PlayServices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable>. The version of Google Play services installed on this device is not authentic.

constants.name: SERVICE_MISSING
constants.summary: Code returned from <Modules.PlayServices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable>. Google Play services is not installed on the device.

constants.name: SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED
constants.summary: Code returned from <Modules.PlayServices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable>. Google Play services is out of date.

constants.name: SUCCESS
constants.summary: Code returned from <Modules.PlayServices.isGooglePlayServicesAvailable>. Google Play services is available, and the connection is successful.
